historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: FCF severely compressed by heavy AI/cloud capex ($53B+ over 3 years). Recent 3-year equity CAGR of 2.3% reflects e-commerce margin pressure. Selected 5% base growth blends equity CAGR (conservative) with revenue trends, adjusting for investment cycle normalization.

base.rationale: Base case assumes gradual FCF recovery as AI capex moderates after 3-year buildout. Growth reflects cloud acceleration (30%+ segment growth) offset by mature China e-commerce. WACC elevated for China risk premium (400bp) + regulatory/geopolitical risks. FCF margin improves from FY2025's 7.4% as capex efficiency gains materialize and e-commerce margins stabilize.

bull.rationale: Bull case: AI + Cloud 'second growth curve' fully materializes with sustained 30-40% cloud growth. E-commerce margin compression reverses as quick commerce achieves profitability and subsidy wars moderate. International commerce (AIDC) reaches sustained profitability adding margin expansion. China consumption recovery drives GMV acceleration. Regulatory overhang diminishes. Lower WACC reflects reduced geopolitical risk. FCF margins expand to historical levels (15-18% range in FY2020-2023).

bear.rationale: Bear case: E-commerce margin collapse structural, not cyclical. Quick commerce subsidy wars continue indefinitely. AI capex yields insufficient ROI as cloud commoditizes. Market share losses to Pinduoduo/Douyin/Meituan accelerate. China macro deterioration worsens. Geopolitical risks escalate (ADR delisting, tariffs, VIE structure challenges). Higher WACC reflects extreme geopolitical/regulatory risk. FCF remains depressed by ongoing heavy capex and working capital deterioration.

valuation.note: Enterprise/equity values in RMB millions. Intrinsic value converted to USD per ADS (1 ADS = 8 ordinary shares, RMB/USD = 7.26)

entry_price.note: All values in USD per ADS (1 ADS = 8 ordinary shares, RMB/USD = 7.26)

base.interpretation: To achieve 15% CAGR to terminal value, entry price of $54.70 USD per ADS required. Current price $88 implies ~4.5% expected CAGR to base case terminal value.

bull.interpretation: Bull case terminal value suggests entry at current levels ($88) offers 23%+ CAGR if AI thesis materializes

bear.interpretation: Bear case implies significant downside risk if geopolitical/competitive risks materialize

sensitivity.note: Intrinsic value in USD per ADS across WACC and terminal growth assumptions. 1 ADS = 8 ordinary shares, RMB/USD = 7.26. Current assumptions: 11.5% WACC, 3.0% terminal growth.

probability_weighted.rationale: Higher weighting to base case given current fundamentals. Bear case probability elevated (25%) due to significant geopolitical/regulatory risks and e-commerce margin compression. Bull case lower probability (20%) pending evidence of AI monetization and margin recovery.

sensitivity_analysis_notes.wacc_justification: Base WACC of 11.5% = 7.5% risk-free + 4.0% China risk premium + beta adjustments. Bull case 10.0% assumes regulatory clarity. Bear case 14.0% incorporates severe geopolitical risk (ADR delisting, tariffs, VIE structure).
sensitivity_analysis_notes.terminal_growth_justification: Terminal growth 2-4% range reflects: (1) China GDP long-term growth 3-4%, (2) BABA market maturity in e-commerce, (3) Cloud growth potential partially offset by e-commerce headwinds, (4) Inflation expectations 2-3%.
sensitivity_analysis_notes.fcf_margin_assumptions: FY2025 FCF margin 7.4% compressed by record capex (RMB 120B deployed). Historical range: 10-18% in FY2018-2023. Base case 10.5% assumes partial recovery. Bull case 13.5% approaches historical average. Bear case 7.0% reflects sustained high capex and margin pressure.

current_valuation_multiples.note: Based on current market cap ~$215B USD, FY2025 EPS $6.70 ADS, consensus FY2027 EPS $8.57

dcf_vs_market.interpretation: Probability-weighted DCF suggests meaningful upside (+30%) in USD per ADS terms. Wide dispersion between scenarios (bull +145%, bear -44%) reflects high uncertainty. Key swing factors: (1) AI/cloud ROI realization, (2) e-commerce margin trajectory, (3) geopolitical risk resolution. Note: RMB financials converted at 7.26 RMB/USD, 1 ADS = 8 ordinary shares.

sum_of_parts_cross_check.method: Applying segment multiples for reasonability check
sum_of_parts_cross_check.interpretation: SOTP analysis suggests current valuation reasonable to slightly undervalued. Market appears to discount e-commerce margin concerns while giving credit to cloud growth. Implies limited margin of safety at current prices.

buy_if: Price falls below $65 (RMB 70 equivalent), providing 40%+ margin of safety to base case
E-commerce margins stabilize with clear path to quick commerce profitability
Cloud revenue sustains 25-30%+ growth with visible AI monetization
Geopolitical risks diminish (regulatory clarity, delisting risk removed)
Management demonstrates capital discipline with AI capex efficiency improvements
hold_if: Price in $70-95 range with mixed signals on margin recovery and cloud growth
AI capex program proceeding on plan ($53B over 3 years) without clear ROI yet
E-commerce competitive dynamics stable but not improving
Geopolitical status quo maintained (no escalation, no resolution)
sell_if: E-commerce margins continue compressing below 7% FCF margin for 4+ quarters
Cloud growth decelerates below 15% or AI products fail to scale
Geopolitical risks materialize (ADR delisting, major tariffs, VIE structure challenged)
Management signals capex above $53B guidance without corresponding revenue upside
Price exceeds $120 without fundamental improvement (valuation risk)

critical_assumptions: FCF recovery from 7.4% (FY2025) to 10.5% (base) assumes AI capex moderates after 3-year buildout and generates returns
E-commerce margin stabilization assumes quick commerce subsidy rationalization within 2-3 years
Cloud growth 25-35% assumes AI demand sustains and BABA captures proportional share
Terminal growth 3% assumes China long-term GDP ~3-4% with BABA maintaining competitive position
WACC 11.5% incorporates 400bp China risk premium; reduction to 10% (bull) or increase to 14% (bear) dramatically changes valuation

scenario_probabilities_rationale.bull_20pct: Requires multiple factors aligning: AI monetization, margin recovery, geopolitical clarity, China consumption rebound. Plausible but not base case.
scenario_probabilities_rationale.base_55pct: Most likely path: gradual FCF recovery, cloud sustains growth, e-commerce stabilizes, muddling through on geopolitics. Reflects current trajectory.
scenario_probabilities_rationale.bear_25pct: Elevated probability due to real geopolitical risks (delisting, tariffs), e-commerce margin collapse severity, and macro uncertainty. Not the base case but material tail risk.

model_limitations: Currency risk not explicitly modeled (RMB/USD fluctuations affect ADS valuation)
Share count assumes modest buybacks but could vary significantly (aggressive buybacks accretive)
Terminal value represents 65-75% of valuation in base/bull cases, highly sensitive to assumptions
Segment-level dynamics simplified; model uses consolidated FCF rather than SOTP approach
Geopolitical risks difficult to quantify probabilistically; captured through WACC and scenario weighting

data_quality_notes.historical_data_reliability: High - audited financials from SEC 20-F filings
data_quality_notes.growth_rate_calculation_period: FY2020-FY2025 for 5-year CAGRs, FY2022-FY2025 for 3-year CAGRs
data_quality_notes.fcf_definition: Operating cash flow minus capex as reported in cash flow statement
data_quality_notes.net_debt_calculation: Total Debt RMB 230,413M - Cash & Equivalents RMB 468,217M = Net Cash RMB 237,804M (FY2025)
data_quality_notes.shares_outstanding: 18,791M as of FY2025 (post-buyback), down from 21,408M in FY2021
data_quality_notes.fiscal_year_note: Alibaba fiscal year ends March 31; FY2025 = April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025
